ja11:1.1: Lucky, the wise and prudent leader of a herd of deer, kept them safe in their journey, while the foolish and careless Unlucky lost his whole herd.
ja11:1.3: Here, _lakkhaṇa_ has the sense “possessing beautiful or auspicious marks”. The description fits the common Chital or “spotted” deer, who are elegant in form, gregarious, and roam in herds.
